candidates.title: Update dependencies
candidates.body: Update dependencies to latest and call the new API instead of removed one.

candidates.title: Update dependencies, Bump package sync interval to 5min, Debian: Add --use-metasnap flag
candidates.body:
- Update dependencies
- Bump package sync interval to 5min
- Debian: Add --use-metasnap flag

candidates.title: Always strip the epoch from buildinfo file urls
Improved logging
candidates.body:
Instead of returning a string with the build log this now creates a `Vec<u8>` and passes it as `&mut Vec<u8>`, in case of any error (even after we've already logged output from the child process) we append to this Vec too and send it back to the daemon, so the build log up to that point isn't lost.

We also include the following info in logs now:
- the size limit, if reached
- the time limit, if reached
- the human readable error, if any, instead of just `rebuilderd: unexpected error while rebuilding package`

candidates.title: Prepare building once per pkgbase
candidates.body:
This rewrites most of the sync code to only build once and set the output status of all output packages at once.

For example, the `rebuilderd` pkgbase in Arch Linux contains two packages:
- `rebuilderd`
- `rebuilderd-tools`

Before this patch we would reproduce each packages individually, effectively running the build twice.

candidates.title: Avoid double-slash in request if endpoint url ends with slash
Refactor rebuilder-backend configuration
candidates.body:
This prepares a switch from the `Distro` enum to an opaque string. The code that automatically detects the right rebuilder-backend location (in eg. `/usr/libexec/rebuilderd/`) has been removed and instead the systems supported by the worker need to be explicitly configured.

Together with the `rebuildctl pkgs sync-stdin` command this should allow building your own integrations with rebuilderd.

candidates.title: Fix race when reading from stdio and waiting for process to exit
Add experimental tails support
candidates.body:
Note the rebuilder worker needs to have KVM available.

I'm committing the Dockerfile that I've worked on although it's not working yet.

The IUKs are currently not built yet, only the full images.

candidates.title: Add in-toto attestations to rebuilderd
candidates.body: Upstreaming @joyliu-q's outstanding work to add in-toto attestations to rebuilderd.

candidates.title: Track required and supported rebuild backends
candidates.body:
This is revising the docker-compose stack into a more usable development setup (also adding instructions on how to do basic development).

Since not every worker can rebuild the any other packages we're now tracking which distro needs to be supported.

This is only informal right now to not break any existing setups.

repo.name: rebuilderd
repo.description: Independent verification of binary packages - Reproducible Builds
